p: Since the third wave, the affected areas expanded and the rural cases increased abruptly, especially in the fifth wave, although the cases were fewer than two in most of the rural areas. However, because of the active live poultry trading and the custom of raising backyard poultry, the virus is very easily transmitted between the village, which leads to the expansion of the contaminated environment and the circulation of the epidemic in new areas. This may increase the risk of exposure to the virus and the possibility of a potential cluster. Additionally, this maybe the reason for the reinforcing trend in the fifth wave.
